ratings.comment: He gives extra credit for answering questions and writing on the board. So everyone rushes to figure out the problem. The class is like a game. Course content wasn't outrageously challenging. Most fun math course I have taken.

If you answer questions in class, you receive extra credit. Exams are straight forward, every question is taken from the HW, lecture, or recommended problems that he gives every week. Good lecturer and can explain things in many ways. English is good and has exceptional handwriting. Writes down explanations.
Very good at explaining the concepts. Gives a large set of problems to know before the exams and uses them as basis for them. Exams are tough. Homework can be a lot but is great prep.

He excels at ensuring students understand the content during lectures. Tests were extremely difficult (mostly proof based questions), although he takes questions directly out of the textbook and gives you the list of possible questions before hand. Overall, one of my better math professors for lectures.

MBT is young (32) and clearly knowledgeable, but he could improve his teaching. Leaves loose ends in lecture. Exam problems are copy/paste from book problems (students are given a huge list), but the ones he selects are often unrelated to the course. Strong proof emphasis. Rewards attendance - told us and did 40% of the final exm in review lectures

Very inconsistent teaching and testing. He was good at going over things he wrote on the board before erasing them, but over half the time I couldn't understand what he was writing (or why in the first place). His tests mostly consisted of proof based questions and were often given in an unreasonable time limit.

Allows extra credit for writing stuff on the board, which is great for the top 5% of the class who understand the proofs flying around.  If you jump through his hoops and feel like devoting like 15 hours a week outside of class, you can do well.  Otherwise, tests are heavily proof-based for a non-proof-based class.  His research is cool.

Ive survived a lot of difficult math courses at this school but this class was an absolute joke. The Homework was straightforward an reasonable. The exams however had almost nothing to do with the homework and more to do with the derivations of the theorems used to solve the homework. That is not what I was taking this class for...

Minh Binh is much, much better than the average math professor! He presents materials in a way that's logical. Offers extra credit for working problems on the board. Only complaint is about the exams. They contain a lot of proofs, more so than the calculations we learned to do in class, which  made things difficult.

Professor Binh is awesome!  He is incredibly helpful in class and office hours.  He really cares if you understand or not and is very patient.  He is also a lot of fun and grading is very fair.  He even gives puzzle challenges for extra credit!
A very helpful professor. Organizes contents well and explains things clearly
